key_risks: Exposure to cyclical downturns in housing and construction markets
Regulatory risks from stricter environmental and carbon emission standards
Global trade tensions and tariffs on wood products
Labor shortages and legal disputes over labor practices
controversies: Class-action lawsuit from a former employee alleging unpaid overtime wages
Over $4.3 million in penalties since 2000 for environmental and labor violations
environmental_issues: Deforestation and habitat disruption in timberland operations
Challenges in balancing sustainable timber harvesting with biodiversity conservation
social_issues: Difficulty attracting and retaining skilled labor in rural areas
Reputational risks from labor disputes and legal challenges
governance_issues: Ongoing compliance risks highlighted by past penalties
Need for stronger oversight to prevent future legal and regulatory violations

sources.title: PotlatchDeltic - Wikipedia
sources.snippet: PotlatchDeltic Corporation [2] (originally Potlatch Corp) is an American diversified forest products company based in Spokane, Washington.. It manufactures and sells lumber, panels and particleboard and receives revenue from other assets such as mineral rights and the leasing of land as well as the sale of land considered expendable. In February 2018, Potlatch acquired Deltic Timber Corp., a ...

sources.title: PotlatchDeltic sells 72,000 acres in northern Minnesota to the ...
sources.snippet: PotlatchDeltic Corp. has sold 72,000 acres of northern Minnesota land to The Conservation Fund, which will keep it as a working forest supplying timber and open for recreation. The $48 million sale is expected to close later this year.
